content.rendered:
Whether you’re a first-time visitor or a seasoned traveler looking to explore this dynamic metropolis, we have compiled a comprehensive resource to ensure your trip is filled with seamless navigation and unforgettable experiences. 

In the following sections, we will provide you with detailed insights into the venue you plan to visit, ensuring you’re well-prepared to make the most of your time there. We will also delve into the travel essentials, offering valuable tips on getting to Taipei and moving around the city. 

Best way to get around in Taipei

Getting around Taipei using public transportation is incredibly convenient, with options like buses, the MRT (Mass Rapid Transit), and Youbike (bicycles). Fares range from around NT$5 to NT$50 for a one-way trip, allowing you to navigate the city smoothly. Google Maps provides precise and detailed transportation guidance.

If you prefer taxis, the fare starts at NT$85, and you can hail them on the street, use an app for booking, or opt for Uber if you’re already a user.

Additionally, we recommend exploring the city on foot. Near TICC in the Xinyi district, you can reach various attractions, delightful restaurants, and bars within a 30-minute walk. In March, walking is definitely an excellent “mode of transport” in Taipei!

All transportations in Taipei

  • Public transportation
    • Getting around Taipei is convenient and easy even if you don’t speak Mandarin. Station names are written in Chinese and English. Announcements are in Mandarin, English, Taiwanese, Hakka, and Japanese.
    • Armed with an Easy Card or single-journey tokens, you can easily take the Mass Rapid Transit (MRT) or buses around the city. 
    • Hours of MRT operation are from 6 am to midnight
  • Taxi/Uber
    • Hailing a cab is easy, but be prepared to have your destination address in Chinese. Fares start at NT$85 or NT$105 between 11pm and 6am.
  • Rideshares
    • There are multiple rideshare/taxi apps in Taiwan. Uber, LINE Taxi, Yoxi are all popular options to get around the city and will accept credit card payments.
  • YouBike
    • Traveling by bike around the city is good exercise and quick. You can rent a YouBike using an EasyCard or iPass. You can register at a YouBike kiosk with your local Taiwanese mobile number if you have one. For those without a Taiwanese number there is the option for linking your credit card via the YouBike 2.0 app for one-time bike rentals. This option will not include public bicycle injury insurance coverage. 

Travel Passes

You can explore Taipei and Taiwan using these options:

MRT Travel Passes

  • Taipei Metro tickets (one-day passes, 24/48/72hr Taipei Metro Passes)
  • Taipei Fun Passes (Transportation Passes and Unlimited Passes, Exploring Passes, Classic Version, 2-day THSR Holiday Tickets and 2-day THSR Joint Tickets).

THSR (Exclusive for foreign passengers)

  • THSR Pass
    • 3-day pass
      • Unlimited rides on Taiwan High Speed Rail trains for three consecutive days.
    • Flexible 2-Day Pass
      • Unlimited rides on Taiwan High Speed Rail trains for any two days of a designated seven-day period.
  • THSR & TRA Join Pass
    • 5-Day Standard Joint Pass
      • Unlimited rides on Taiwan Railway Chu-Kuang Express or trains at a lower price than Chu-Kuang Express for five days and on Taiwan High Speed Rail trains for any two days within the designated five days.
    • 5-Day Premium Joint Pass
      • Unlimited rides on Taiwan Railway Tze-Chiang Limited Express or trains at a lower price than Tze-Chiang Limited Express for 5 days and on Taiwan High Speed Rail trains for any two days within the designated five days.

More Travel Information:

  • 9 Useful Apps in Taiwan
  • Webinar Summary: Travel to Taiwan with Ease
  • Airport Information

title.rendered: Ways to Contribute Beyond Coding for WordPress

content.rendered:
Contributing to WordPress doesn’t have to be all code. There are many other ways to get involved with the community and support the platform.

Documentation

Good documentation lets people help themselves when they get stuck. The docs team is responsible for creating documentation and is always on the lookout for writers. You don’t need any technical expertise to contribute, just a willingness to explain things clearly. The docs cover everything from using the software to developing themes and plugins.

Translation

If you’re bilingual, consider translating WordPress into your native language. You can translate the core software, themes, plugins, and documentation. Translation helps make WordPress accessible to more people around the world.

Support

Helping others is what the WordPress community is all about. You can provide support by answering questions on the forums, helping newcomers in Facebook groups, or mentoring folks in your local WordPress community. Even if you’re still learning yourself, you can offer moral support.

Organizing Events

Those WordCamps and meetups don’t organize themselves! You can volunteer to help plan events in your city. Tasks include finding venues and speakers, promoting the events, and handling logistics on the day. It’s a great way to boost your organizational skills and network.

There are so many ways to get involved with WordPress beyond writing code. Whatever your interests or abilities, the community has a place for you. Contributing will enrich your own WordPress experience, as you help others and build new connections. So go ahead, take the plunge, and become a contributor – you have so much to offer!

title.rendered: Getting Started as a First-Time Contributor

content.rendered:
Getting started as a first-time contributor at WordCamp Asia Contributor Day may seem intimidating, but don’t worry, it’s easier than you think. Anyone with a WordPress.org profile can join in and help out. Here are some ways new contributors can get involved:

Community Support

Answering questions on the WordPress.org support forums is a great way for new contributors to help others in the community. You don’t need to be an expert to provide helpful responses and guidance. Just share your experiences using WordPress and politely point people to helpful resources.

Documentation

Improve the WordPress Codex by contributing to documentation. You can translate articles, update outdated information, fill in missing details, or write new pages on topics you’re familiar with. The Codex is a living resource that depends on community members to keep it current.

Submitting Photos

If you enjoy photography, consider submitting your WordPress-related photos to the stock photo library. Photos of people using WordPress, keyboards, laptops, and mobile devices are especially useful. With your permission, your photos may appear on WordPress.org and in official presentations. Photo submissions are a simple way to contribute for those without technical skills.

Don’t be afraid to contribute just because you can’t code. WordCamp Contributor Day and the WordPress community as a whole welcome all types of contributions, big and small. Find an area you’re passionate about and share your skills with others. You’ll be giving back to the community in no time!

Contributor Day Page

content.rendered:
So you want to contribute to WordPress at WordCamp Asia 2024, but you have some questions. No worries, we’ve got you covered. Here are some frequently asked questions about contributing to help put you at ease.

Do I have to know how to code to contribute?

Absolutely not. While coding contributions are always welcome, there are many other ways to contribute that don’t require any coding knowledge. You can translate plugins and themes into your native language, help translate codex articles, submit photos, answer support questions on the forums, write blog posts, organize a local WordCamp, and more.

What if I’ve never contributed before?

No problem at all. Everyone has to start somewhere. The WordPress community is extremely welcoming to new contributors. The Contributor Day organizers and mentors will guide you through the process and help you find a contribution you’re comfortable with based on your skills and interests. You’ll be contributing in no time.

How do I know which team to contribute to?

With over 20 teams actively involved in various aspects of the WordPress project each day, our dedicated community provides chances for everyone to contribute.

Discovering the right team is crucial for a fulfilling contributor experience. Our interactive questionnaire is designed to guide you in identifying where to begin.

Whether you enjoy coding, working with content, identifying bugs, or assisting others, contributing to WordPress allows your distinct skills and interests to fuel innovation in a global open source initiative aimed at democratizing publishing. Locate your team(s) and join us in making WordPress together.

Ready to take a look? Find your team here.

How much time do I have to commit?

You can contribute as little or as much time as you like. Some contributions only take a few minutes, while others are ongoing. It’s completely up to you and what works with your schedule. Every little bit helps.

Do I get paid to contribute?

Contributing to WordPress is voluntary. While you won’t get paid, there are other benefits like connecting with the community, learning new skills, improving your resume, and building your portfolio. Some contributors have even turned their passion for WordPress into full-time jobs and careers.

What if I have more questions?

The Contributor Day mentors and organizers are there to help answer any questions you may have. You can also check out the Make WordPress site which details how the contribution process works and ways you can get involved. The most important thing is just to dive in—you’ll learn so much along the way.

Contributing to WordPress can be a rewarding experience. Don’t let uncertainty hold you back. Come to Contributor Day, meet fellow WordPress enthusiasts, find a project you connect with, and start contributing. The community will be there to guide you each step of the way.

title.rendered: WordCamp Asia 2024 繁中版活動介紹

content.rendered:
March 7–9, 2024 | Taipei, Taiwan

Celebrate WordPress, Experience Asia.

亞洲首屈一指的開源網路高峰會

馬上購票

~2,000

會眾

70+

國家

50+

講者

40+

贊助商

踏入網路創新的未來，與業界精英建立人脈！

不論你是開發者、數位行銷人員、UI/UX 設計師、或科技產業的創業家，這是你探索尖端網路技術、分享創新想法，以及建立高價值人脈的大好機會。

2024 年三月 7 ～9 日

台北國際會議中心 (TICC)

馬上購票

什麼是 WordCamp?

WordCamp 象徵了開源領域的影響力與協作力，現今世界上有 43% 的網站都使用 WordPress 作為系統，代表了當代網路世界開創的基石與科技的未來。
作為全球三大洲際級 WordCamp 之一，WordCamp Asia 站在這場網路潮流的浪頭，匯聚了所有喜愛 WordPress 的專業人士、創業家、科技領航者，一同歡慶與推動開源技術與數位創新的前進。

參與 WordCamp Asia 的好處包含：

  • 聆聽產業界頂尖人士的演講
  • 與創新的參展贊助商互動、建立人脈、結交同好
  • 參與工作坊、共創日，與強大的開發者一起形塑網路世界的未來

沉浸在一個充滿啟發性、知識力、和正向交流的環境中。

*活動及演講以英文進行，現場會有中文字幕。

三月 7 日 (四)

Contributor Day
共創日

參與在台灣首個共創日，與其他頂尖的開發者、專業人士攜手形塑網路世界的未來。

三月 8 日 (五)

Conference Day 1
研討會

向來自全球科技領域的專業人士及業界領導者學習並建立人脈，拓展視野並創造機會。

三月 9 日 (六)

Conference Day 2 & After Party
研討會 & 會後交流

會後還有為所有會眾精心設計的交流派對，和其他與會者齊聚歡笑，建立長久的友誼。

參與 WordCamp Asia 等於置身於開放原始碼領域的中心，這是許多最佳人才的匯聚之地，不只是一場研討會，更是學習、交流、分享與創新的場域。

2024 年三月 7 ～9 日

台北國際會議中心 (TICC)

馬上購票

追蹤社群媒體持續獲得最新活動資訊

  • Facebook
  • X
  • Instagram
  • YouTube
  • LinkedIn

title.rendered: Contributor Day: More Than Just Code

content.rendered:
Have you been thinking about contributing to WordPress but feel your coding skills might not measure up? Look no further! WordCamp Asia’s Contributor Day on March 7, 2024, provides the perfect opportunity for you to jump in, and it’s not just about code. Join hundreds of WordPress enthusiasts and top engineers at the Taipei International Convention Center for a day devoted to making meaningful contributions to the platform.

Simply put, we want to tell you more than just how awesome it is to join Contributor Day for giving back. While that’s important, there are other really exciting things we’ve all personally enjoyed:

  • Engage with WordPress Pioneers: Talk with some of the top WordPress experts from around the world.
  • Guidance at Every Level: Regardless of your skill level, you’ll receive valuable guidance throughout the day.
  • Embrace Mistakes: Contributor Day is a safe space where making mistakes is not just accepted but encouraged as part of the learning process.
  • Immediate Impact: Your contributions could be accepted and integrated into the next version of WordPress right away.

So, mark your calendar for March 7, 2024, and join us for a day filled with camaraderie, learning, and the opportunity to make a real impact on the WordPress platform, no matter your level of expertise.

What Is Contributor Day at WordCamp Asia 2024?

Contributor Day is a full day of contributing to the WordPress open source project at WordCamp Asia 2024, it will be held on March 7, 2024, the first day of the event. This is an opportunity for anyone who wants to get involved in the WordPress community to contribute in various ways.

You don’t have to be a coder to contribute. There are many ways for newcomers to help out, from translating plugins and themes to answering support questions on the forums. Contributing to WordPress means helping build the platform in ways big and small.

People contribute to WordPress for a variety of reasons, each rooted in personal motivations and a shared commitment to the open-source community. Some contribute to enhance their skills, others to give back to a platform they rely on. Many find joy in collaborating with a global community, fostering connections, and making a positive impact on a project that powers a significant portion of the web. Ultimately, the diverse reasons for contribution collectively drive the growth and success of WordPress, creating a vibrant ecosystem built on collaboration and shared passion.

Contributor Day at WordCamp Asia 2024 is a chance for anyone in the WordPress community to help move the platform forward. Don’t be afraid to contribute – there are many ways to help beyond just code. Come be a part of this collaborative event and make a difference!

Building Community Through Contributions

Contributing to WordPress is about more than just code. At WordCamp Asia 2024’s Contributor Day, you’ll find that contributing also builds community. Anyone can contribute in their own way, whether or not you know how to code.

Share Your Knowledge

If you’ve built a theme or plugin, consider publishing it on the WordPress.org repository to share it with others. Write a blog post or tutorial to teach people what you’ve learned. Answer support questions on the forums to help fellow users. These contributions spread knowledge and bring people together.

Promote Inclusiveness

We want the WordPress community to be welcoming and open to all. You can help by organizing or volunteering at a local meetup to connect with other users face-to-face. Start a diversity and inclusion group in your area. Help make WordCamps accessible by live-streaming or providing real-time translations. Focus on building community.

At Contributor Day, you’ll find many opportunities to build community through promoting inclusiveness, sharing knowledge, translation, and more. Don’t be afraid to contribute in your own way. The WordPress community welcomes you and values all the ways people come together from around the world. Join us!

The Teams you can join

Starting your contribution journey is a breeze! Simply visit this link to access our orientation tool. It’s the exclusive way to guide you in selecting a table, ensuring a smooth and straightforward process for finding the right team.

Accessibility

The Accessibility Team provides accessibility expertise across the project to improve the accessibility of WordPress core and resources.

If you are interested in making WordPress accessible to everyone, join us!

Community

This Team oversees official events, mentorship programs, diversity initiatives, contributor outreach, and other ways of growing the WordPress community. 

If you are curious about how to start a Meetup in your city or how you can organise a WordCamp, then join the Community Team.

Core / Core Performance

The Core Team builds WordPress! Get involved and learn about general updates, status reports, and the occasional code debate. If you find a bug, you may create a ticket in the core bug tracker. You can get started quickly with core tickets marked as good first bugs for new contributors or join a bug scrub.

Our table leads will guide you on starting contributing to the Core. Join the Core Team and learn quickly.

Design

The Design Team provides the user experience, user interface, and visual design expertise for the WordPress project. This includes design for the WordPress product, the WordPress.org network, and community projects. All levels of experience are welcome.

Documentation

The Documentation Team is responsible for WordPress documentation, and current goals are the retirement of Codex, enrichment of the Block Editor manual, and localisation of documentation. Please join this table if you are interested in those topics or want to brush up on the current user guide. You can see the list of documentation issues and can work on it as well. All the issues are listed in the GitHub repository.

Marketing

The Make WordPress Global Marketing team comprises individuals driven by a deep passion for WordPress. Its contributors specialize in diverse fields, including social media, digital marketing, analytics, and more. Whether writers, analysts, or communicators, they share a common love for data and a curiosity about human behavior. For those interested in joining, the team welcomes individuals from varied backgrounds to contribute their skills and enthusiasm to the WordPress community.

Meta

The Meta Team manages software for WordPress.org sites, APIs, and tools. They support other teams by maintaining and updating websites and tools like Theme and Plugin directories, Showcase, Support Forums, WordCamp Central, and GlotPress.

Patterns

The Pattern helps WordPress users add a beautifully designed, ready-to-go layout to any WordPress site with a simple copy/paste. Join this Team and submit patterns that are uniquely beautiful in their own way.

Photos

The Photo Directory Team moderates every photo submitted to the WordPress Photo Directory, maintains and improves the directory site itself, and provides resources and documentation to educate, encourage, and facilitate photo contributors. You can join the Team and learn how to get involved.

Plugins

The Plugins Team acts as gate-keepers and fresh eyes on newly submitted plugins and reviews any reported security or guideline violations.

You can start contributing Plugins Team by reporting the Plugin security issue as well.

Polyglots

The Polyglots Team translates WordPress into more than 200 languages. If you’re fluent in a language other than US English, you’re welcome to join us and help bring WordPress to people around the world.

If you’re new to the world of WordPress, this is one of the easiest ways to contribute. You can join Polyglots and translate WordPress or a  plugin/theme of your choice in your own native language.

Support

The Support Team is responsible for helping users at WordPress’ Support Forums so they can make the most out of their WordPress websites. They answer everything they can, from basic WordPress questions to advanced development topics. Everyone knows the answer to something!

You can join the Support Team and contribute easily.

Themes

The Themes Team evaluates each theme submitted from all across the world to the official directory and provides input and requests for correction when appropriate. Reviewing themes sharpens your own theme development skills. You can help out and join the discussion on the blog.

Training

The Training Team creates downloadable lesson plans and related materials for instructors to use in live environments such as meetups and workshops. Also, “Learn WordPress” is focused on Training Material.

You can join this Team and help create training materials, online workshops, etc.

So there you have it, Contributor Day offers something for everyone in the WordPress community. Don’t be intimidated by the idea of contributing code if that’s not your strength. This day is all about bringing together people from all walks of life who share a common passion for the open-source platform that powers over a third of the internet. Come with an open mind and willingness to help in any way you can. Connect with like-minded folks, pick up a new skill, and share your experience with others – it’s a win-win. When we come together, we can accomplish amazing things. See you in Taipei next March for what’s sure to be an unforgettable Contributor Day!

Contributor Day Floor Plan

More information:

Contributor Day Table Leads

Contributor Day Schedule

Contributor Day Human Library

Ways to Contribute Beyond Coding for WordPress

Getting Started as a First-Time Contributor

Contributor Day FAQ

We are proud to present our global media partners, carefully selected from dozens of applications. These esteemed media outlets represent a diverse range of perspectives from around the world, ensuring that our audience and sponsors feel connected to a truly global network! Below, you will find each partner’s logos along with a brief introduction highlighting their unique contributions and expertise.

Media Partners of WordCamp Asia 2024

TNL Mediagene

Exclusive Media Partner in Taiwan

TNL Mediagene stands as a leading force in the Pan-Asian market as a rapidly expanding platform in media, digital advertising, and data analytics, catering to a global digital audience with its impactful and wide-ranging content. The platform not only provides the public with up-to-date news and insightful commentaries but also empowers brands through robust data analytics and fosters connections with cutting-edge technology. This positions TNL Mediagene as a pivotal ally in meeting the digital transformation demands of various enterprises.

The company encompasses 21 content brands and 13 subsidiaries and operates with a dedicated workforce of over 560 professionals based across Asia.

  • Link

DevotePress

DevotePress is a specialized website devoted entirely to WordPress. Our focus is on providing comprehensive news and updates, encompassing all aspects of WordPress. Our platform offers an in-depth look at the global WordPress community, ensuring our audience stays informed about the latest developments. Follow us for a closer and more engaging perspective on everything WordPress.

  • Link

Do the Woo

Do the Woo is a dynamic platform that nurtures the growth of the WooCommerce builder community, encompassing developers, freelancers, and agencies. We are committed to elevating voices within the community, supporting talented contributors, and fostering connections among developers, designers, and agencies in the WooCommerce and WordPress ecosystem. Our focus is on individual empowerment and collective growth, ensuring every member of our community thrives in this ever-evolving digital landscape.

  • Link

Go with WP

Go with WP is dedicated to all things WordPress, serving as a pivotal platform for millions of bloggers and developers worldwide. It offers a rich array of themes, meticulously crafted by skilled developers, catering to a diverse audience that includes WordPress users, developers, marketers, and students eager to start their careers in WordPress. This site stands as a testament to WordPress’s ease of use and its global impact, providing essential resources and insights for the WordPress community.

  • Link

Mayank Kumar

Mayank Kumar’s website serves as a hub for those interested in WordPress, from users and developers to marketers and students aspiring to start careers in this field, offering insights into his projects and startup. He’s also editor at the web agency website (webwallah.in) and also ed-tech website (jnvstprep.com / cshub.in).

  • Link

Post Status

Since 2013, Post Status has established itself as a unique, member-supported WordPress community, catering to professionals, solopreneurs, agencies, and businesses of all sizes. It’s a hub where WordPress experts at all career stages connect, share insights, and grow together. This community, known for its inclusive and diverse environment, aims to guide and support the WordPress ecosystem, sustaining the Open Web. Post Status is more than just a community; it’s a resource for professional development, mentorship, and collaboration among WordPress enthusiasts

  • Link

WPQRST by Riddleman FM

Riddleman FM offers a diverse radio experience, with over 500,000 hours of music from 40,000+ radios across 187 countries in 119 genres and 24 languages. It’s designed for a broad audience aged 20-55, interested in talk shows, music, and global tech trends. This platform caters to listeners seeking curated music collections for every mood and activity. WPQRST (a part of Riddleman infra) is a podcast series dedicated to WordPress Questions, Rockstars, Startups & Talks.

  • Link

TechSathi

TechSathi, Nepal’s leading tech news portal, caters to tech entrepreneurs, enthusiasts, and student developers. It covers a wide range of topics including technology, gadgets, startups, and entrepreneurship, aiming to be a community hub rather than just another tech blog. TechSathi is dedicated to promoting startups, organizing events and workshops, and supporting innovative ventures.

  • Link

The Filipino Tech Explainer

Bob Reyes’ blog, “The Filipino Tech Explainer”, focuses on tech and lifestyle, delivering explainer-style articles. Originating in 2003, the site covers CMS, PHP, web databases, and WordPress, managed by technologist and former college professor Bob Reyes, who has over two decades of experience in both the tech and aviation industries.

  • Link

The Repository

The Repository is a weekly newsletter that delves into the WordPress world, offering a 5-minute read of the most relevant news and opinions every Friday. It sources from over 100 news and community platforms, curating content by hand to ensure the highest quality. This newsletter targets a wide audience within the WordPress ecosystem, including business owners, professionals, and developers, providing them with the latest project, community, theme, plugin, business, and event news.

  • Link

The WPWeekly

The WPWeekly is a specialized newsletter crafted for WordPress professionals, including agency owners, freelancers, and DIY enthusiasts. It focuses on the vast WordPress community, with the goal of delivering the most essential updates and insights in a concise format. Each issue of The WPWeekly is designed to be a quick read, not exceeding 10 minutes, ensuring busy WordPress professionals can stay informed without a significant time commitment. This newsletter serves as a valuable resource for those immersed in the WordPress ecosystem, providing timely and relevant information tailored to their needs.

  • Link

Un billete a Chattanooga

“Un billete a Chattanooga”, hosted by Ana Cirujano and Pablo Moratinos, is a podcast focusing on design, marketing, WordPress, and digital entrepreneurship. It appeals to Spanish-speaking professionals like designers, web developers, and digital marketers. The weekly show features a range of admired guests, offering insights and discussions relevant to the digital business community”.

  • Link

WP-Content.co

WP-Content.co is a WordPress-focused site, offering free guides, reviews, and news about plugins, themes, and hosting services. It’s designed for beginners and WordPress savvies, sharing the best of WordPress resources. Additionally, we publish The WP Week, a popular weekly newsletter, and The WP Week Podcast, keeping WordPress enthusiasts updated with the latest trends and insights in the WordPress world. Catering to a diverse audience, the site helps users navigate and excel in the WordPress ecosystem. 

  • Link

WP Builds

WP Builds, a podcast for all WordPress levels, offers weekly shows on the latest trends and insights. Hosting deals and various content, it’s a go-to resource for everyone from novices to power users. Learn more at wpbuilds.com, where the community thrives under the motto ‘Be Polite, Always’.

  • Link

WPLift

Founded in 2010, WPLift is a comprehensive resource for WordPress users, offering tutorials, theme roundups, plugin guides, and news. It has grown to reach hundreds of thousands annually, featuring directories, coupon codes, and hosting reviews. WPLift, now part of the UnlimitedWP family, continues to expand, helping users navigate and excel in the WordPress ecosystem.

  • Link

網站帶路姬 WPointer

WPointer, catering primarily to Taiwanese audiences and others from regions like Hong Kong, Malaysia, China, the US, Japan, Australia, England, and Canada, focuses on WordPress users who are beginners in programming. The site offers free introductory courses in WordPress, making it an ideal resource for novices to power users seeking to learn and grow in the field.

  • Link

XWP

XWP caters to enterprise WordPress users, developers, and open-source enthusiasts, offering expert web design and development. Known for creating seamless user experiences, their team excels in custom WordPress development, tackling unique projects with over a century of combined expertise. Ideal for WordPress novices to power users, XWP builds fast, efficient websites, enhancing digital business performance.

  • Link

Position Your Brand at the Forefront of WordPress Innovation in the APAC Region

Seize this opportunity to elevate your brand’s presence and contribute to the future of WordPress.

As a partner at WordCamp Asia, you’ll be connected to a large, diverse and passionate audience of tech enthusiasts, developers, and thought leaders in the rapidly evolving world of web.

WordCamp Asia: The Premier Open Source Web Summit of Asia

Join us at WordCamp Asia 2024, the leading conference for the APAC WordPress community, as we gather thousands of developers, designers, and users. With WordPress powering over 43% of the web, this is a strategic opportunity to align your brand with the core of online influence.

WordCamps are not just conferences; they are vibrant hubs where the future of the web takes shape. WordCamp Asia is is the largest WordCamp in the APAC region which hosts a sprawling community of WordPress enthusiasts, developers, designers, agency owners, media publishers, content creators and users who all contribute to the WordPress ecosystem.

Download the prospectus
下載中文版贊助簡報

Why Sponsor WordCamp Asia?

In March 2024, Taipei becomes the epicenter of a convergence of minds, hosting over 2,000 attendees from 71 countries. They represent a broad cross-section of people working in tech, from agency owners to media publishers, developers to content creators. 

Sponsoring WordCamp Asia is an opportunity to position your brand front-and-center to the people shaping the future of the digital landscape in Asia, including our media partners who help to generate coverage of the event.

  • Unparalleled Exposure: Connect with a global audience and showcase your brand alongside the technology driving nearly half of the internet.
  • Market Your Brand: Put your business in front of over 2000 attendees at the forefront of digital innovation, through entitlements including logo placements on key collateral. 
  • Generate Leads: Create business relationships with agencies, developers, marketers and bloggers, through entitlements including sponsor booths in our exhibitor area.
  • Collect Feedback: Have direct conversations with your existing or prospective customers, through entitlements including access to networking events.  
  • Support the Community: Contribute to the growth of open-source software, with your sponsorship helping to keep WordCamp Asia accessible to all audiences. 

Depending on your level of sponsorship, entitlements include:

  • A booth in the exhibitor area
  • Logo placement on backdrops, banners, the event guide and the WordCamp Asia website
  • Dedicated social media promotion
  • Tickets to the conference and networking events
Download the prospectus
下載中文版贊助簡報

Sponsor WordCamp Asia

Take a virtual tour of the venue, TICC

Secure prime visibility among key industry players, ranging from agency owners to media publishers, developers, and content creators. This sponsorship opportunity positions your brand as a leader in the shaping of the Asian tech landscape.

Sponsorship packages to WordCamp Asia vary to suit your budget:

  • Jade Mountain: $35,000 USD
  • Snow Mountain: $25,000 USD
  • Xiuguluan Mountain: $15,000 USD
  • Data Mountain: $7,000 USD
  • Xingang Mountain: $2,500 USD

We are excited to announce the official hotel, a fantastic 5-star hotel to enhance your stay:

Grand Hyatt Taipei

The Grand Hyatt Taipei, situated in the Xinyi District of Taipei, is a 5-star hotel that offers luxurious accommodations and is our official hotel partner for WordCamp Asia. Conveniently located near the event venue, the Taipei International Convention Center (TICC), it is just a 5-minute walk away.

Note: the reserved rooms are already sold out.

For WordCamp Asia attendees, we will provide a unique URL and coupon code through which you can access our significantly competitive offer. If you have already purchased tickets, we will notify you via email when the coupon becomes available.

Hotel Information

Address: No. 2, SongShou Road, Taipei, Taiwan
Tel: +886-2-2720-1234

From Airport to Hotel

From Taipei Songshan Airport, take the MRT Brown Line to Daan Station, then switch to the Red Line to reach Taipei 101/World Trade Center Station.

From Taiwan Taoyuan International Airport, use the Taoyuan Airport MRT to connect with the Taipei Metro at Taipei Main Station, then transfer to the Red Line.

Taxis and Uber are convenient from both airports, costing around NT$200 from Songshan and NT$1,200 from Taoyuan. Additionally, the Grand Hyatt Hotel offers luxury limousine services starting from NT$1,500 for Songshan and NT$2,900 for Taoyuan, featuring amenities like Wi-Fi and power outlets.

Learn more about getting around Taipei

Hotel Facilities Reminders

Oasis Fitness Center:

  • The Oasis Fitness Center is located on the 5th floor, including both indoor and outdoor facilities, equipped with the most advanced fitness equipment, sauna, and an outdoor heated swimming pool.
  • Please do not wear a swimsuit or other clothes when using the sauna.
  • Children under 16 are prohibited from using the sauna.
  • The fitness center is open 24 hours a day, but hotel staff are available only between 05:30 and 23:00.
  • Access to the fitness center is possible with the room key.

Oasis Spa:

  • Oasis Spa offers over 10 types of all-natural body treatments, massages, and specialty skincare products.
  • The operating hours of the SPA are from 11:00 to 22:00.
  • The latest appointment time for SPA treatments is 21:00.

Dining

Indulge in the exceptional culinary adventure at Grand Hyatt Taipei. Featuring some of the best Taipei hotel buffet experiences, Michelin Guide recommended fine dining restaurant, authentic Chinese and Cantonese palate, classic Italian and many more, the 8 diverse and unique restaurants and bars will sure to delight guests of both local and international.

Important Reminders

  • The number of discounted reserved rooms is limited. Please book your room as soon as possible to receive this special discount.
  • These discounts are only valid for bookings made using the above methods.
  • No reservation cancellation is allowed. In the case of a no-show, a full stay charge will apply to the guest’s credit card.
  • Maximum 2 guests per room.
  • The rate includes all taxes.
  • If there are any questions or additional requirements, please directly contact the hotel.

Enjoy The Local Delights and Diverse Global Cuisines

As we gather for WordCamp Asia 2024 in Taiwan, we’re excited to also offer a taste of the island’s incredible culinary diversity. Taiwan is not just a hub for technological innovation; it’s also a melting pot of flavors that caters to food lovers from all corners of the globe. Whether you’re seeking traditional Taiwanese specialties, international cuisines, vegetarian dishes, halal food, or gluten-free options, you’ll find that Taiwan’s food scene is varied and inclusive. We understand the importance of nourishing both the mind and the body, and we are delighted to guide you through a gastronomic journey that reflects the diverse tastes and dietary preferences of our global attendees. 

Vegetarian (near TICC)

  • Herbivore A4 (Vegan / Western)
  • VEGE CREEK (Taiwanese Lu Wei)
  • Miacucina (Italian)
  • Polam Kopitiam (Malaysian)
  • Falafel King (Mid-Eastern)

Jain-friendly Vegetarian 

Note: There are very few restaurants that serve strictly Jain vegetarian food. In regular vegetarian restaurants, they might use the same pot to cook onion or garlic. Please be aware of this if you adhere strictly to Jain dietary rules.

  • Mayur Indian Kitchen (Indian Food)

Halal Dining (near TICC) 

  • HALAL Chinese beef noodle restaurant (Chinese food)
  • Halal Chinese Beef Noodles (Chinese food)
  • Khana Kazana (Indian food)
  • Tajin Moroccan Cuisine (Morocco food)
  • Taj Indian Restaurant (Indian food)
  • Kedai Sri Rahayu (Indonesian food)
  • ROYAL / INDONESIAN FOOD (Indonesian food )
  • Chang’s Beef Noodle (Chinese Food)
  • Halal Yellow Beef Noodle (Chinese food)
  • Yunus Halal Restaurant (Thailand food)
  • Kunming Halal Restaurant (Middle east food)
  • 水料理 (fresh cuisine ) Halal MUSLIM FRIENDLY (chinese food, muslim friendly, they separate between halal and non-halal food)
  • 炸雞大獅 Fried Chicken Master Halal (Franchise of Halal Fried Chicken Master)
    • This is the only franchise of Halal fried chicken available in Taiwan, with various stores located across Taipei.

Indian Restaurants

Reference

  • Masala Art
  • 阿里巴巴的廚房 Ali Baba’s Indian Kitchen
  • Mayur Indian Kitchen, Halal Restaurant

  • Out of India Shida Branch
  • Tibet Kitchen Taiwan
  • burans Indian kitchen~Sanchong

Local food 

Reference

  1. Braised Beef Noodle Soup (Niu Rou Mian 牛肉麵)
    • Yong Kang Beef Noodles (永康牛肉麺館)
    • Liao Jia Beef Noodle Restaurant (廖家牛肉麵)

    • Chun Shui Tang (春水堂 Multiple locations across Taiwan）
  2. Scallion and Daikon (Radish) Pancake

Bubble Tea!!

Bubble Tea is one of the representatives of Taiwanese culture. We crafted another dedicated page specifically to introduce it! Check it out here.

Besides the mentioned cuisines, Taiwanese local food offers an exciting array of street delicacies that beckon the adventurous palate. From the daringly aromatic stinky tofu to the savory oyster pancake, and the unique pig blood cake, there’s an endless variety to explore. Taipei, in particular, is a melting pot of global culinary influences, fostering a vibrant and evolving eating culture.

1. About the event
    1. When and where is WordCamp Asia 2024? 
    2. Ticket questions 
    3. Contributor Day questions 
  2. Travel Help
  3. Official Hotel
  4. Volunteer questions 
  5. Payment questions

About the event

When and where is WordCamp Asia 2024? 

  • WordCamp Asia 2024 will be held at the Taipei International Convention Center (TICC)  in Taipei, Taiwan from Thursday, March 7th to Saturday, March 9th, 2024.
  • The closest MRT station is Taipei 101/World Trade Center (捷運台北101／世貿站) Exit 1. For more detailed information about the venue, please visit the location page.

Ticket questions 

How do I register for WordCamp Asia 2024? 

Tickets will be released in batches. Follow us on social media for announcements regarding Batch 3 and 4. To register, head on over to the tickets page and grab your ticket. 

How much do WordCamp Asia tickets cost?

We have Regular tickets for NT$950, or Micro-Sponsor tickets for NT$9,500. For more details, visit the tickets page. 

Are tickets refundable?
  • Yes. Please visit the Ticket Refund Process and follow the steps to cancel.
  • Don’t want to cancel? You can also transfer your ticket by editing the ticket information in the confirmation email. For more details, follow the steps here. 

How many tickets can I purchase at once?

You can purchase as many tickets as you like, subject to the availability of each batch.

What payment methods are available?

We accept all major credit cards and purchases are processed through Stripe. PayPal is also available.

I’m planning to apply as a speaker/volunteer, but I won’t know if I’d be accepted until later. Should I buy a ticket?

Yes. In case you are selected, you can request a refund. Please visit the ticket link in the email we sent when you purchased the ticket and click on the link to request a refund. Please note that no refund requests will be accepted after February, 9 2023.

What does my ticket include? 
  • Three-day events including workshops, presentations and networking events.
  • Lunch, snacks, and coffee will be provided throughout the day. 
  • Entry to our afterparty and opportunity to register for Contributor Day (March 7)

Contributor Day questions 

Do I need a separate ticket for the Contributor Day?

Yes. Make sure you have a Contributor Day ticket if you plan to participate. This is a separate ticket from WordCamp Asia tickets for session days. For more information, please check our official announcements.

What should I bring on Contributor Day?
  • Laptop – for accessing the Make WordPress Slack instance and the team’s online-based onboarding materials.
  • Email Ticket – to get the name badge and to enter the venue.
Can you help me with choosing the team? I am interested but unsure of which table to choose. 

Contributing is easier than you think! Feel free to contact us and organizers can suggest a team or you can join the #contributor-day channel in Make WordPress Slack and ask your questions. We also have an orientation tool available to guide you in picking a table.

What do you get in return for contributing?

WordPress is driven by a commitment to open source, inclusiveness, giving, and diversity. There are a lot of reasons people choose to become active contributors. Find out how you’ll benefit from contributing to WordPress as well.

Do I need to have prior experience?
  • No, you don’t need any prior contributing experience – anyone can get involved. Many new contributors get started at Contributor Days on WordCamps around the world. That is a great way of gaining experience and improving your skills whilst making a meaningful contribution to a widely-used open-source WordPress project.
  • For those unsure about how they can best contribute to the WordPress project, a Contributor Day also represents an opportunity to dip a toe in the water of the different areas and ways of contributing and to discover what appeals to you or matches your skillset.
I am a developer. Can I still join?
  • Of course! There are a number of Teams where your skills will be helpful. Maybe you can join the Core, Meta, or CLI Team and contribute.
Do I need to prepare for it?
  • Though not mandatory, you will get more from the day if you arrive with some idea of what you want to do and if you take a little time beforehand to prepare. To help you decide on a contributing area, visit the Make WordPress website for information about what each Team does. 
  • We will also release a series of onboarding guides to help you prepare for the event with instructions on how to set up your computer with any software you might need on the big day to help ensure you can hit the ground running.
Do I need to be a developer?
  • No, you do not have to be a programmer to take part. There are plenty of other ways to contribute to WordPress and its ecosystem. At the time of writing, there are 21 Teams involved in making WordPress. Here are some examples of tasks that benefit the community but don’t require a single line of code:
    • Do you speak more than one language? If so, the Polyglots Team would love to have you on board to help in translating the Core, themes, plugins, or documentation into other languages. There is much to do in this area
    • Are you great at explaining complex topics clearly and simply? Then you have a way with words and an ability to communicate and explain things in a way that makes it easy for others to understand. You would be great at writing documentation.
    • Do you have video production skills or a keen eye for design? The WordPress TV and Design teams are always looking for new contributors.

Travel Help

Do I need visa to enter Taiwan?

Depending on your nationality, you may have different visa requirements to enter Taiwan. Please refer to the visa information for detailed information.

What is the best airport for me to fly into?

There are two suggested airports: Taoyuan International Airport and Taipei Songshan Airport. Please learn more at the location page.

What’s the best way to get around in Taipei

You can take MRT (Taipei Metro), public bus, Uber, taxi, or ride a YouBike (shared bike). More details: How to get around

Is Taipei safe to travel by myself?

Traveling alone in Taipei is generally safe due to its low crime rate and friendly locals, but it’s wise to stay vigilant and secure your belongings, especially in crowded areas.

What phone service / sim card should I get?

The most popular mobile carriers are Taiwan Mobile, Chunghwa Telecom, and Far EasTone Telecom. If you don’t already have a Taiwanese SIM card, you can obtain one at the airport. You will need to show a passport, and a second form of ID to get a SIM card. 

Where to get vegetarian food?

Taiwan is vegetarian-friendly. We have compiled a list of restaurants recommended by locals. Please refer to the Taste of Taiwan for more information.

Official Hotel

Is the breakfast included in the hotel rates? 

All discounted rooms include breakfast. Additional breakfast is available at NT$900 plus a 10% service charge per person (regardless of adults or children).

The cancellation policy

Any cancellation made after 14 days prior to every reservation’s arrival date will be subject to a whole period charge per booking as the cancellation penalty.

For example, if you make a reservation starting from March 6th, 2024, you may cancel the room without additional charge before February 21st. You will take back your deposit if any deposit has been paid.

How to manage my booking

If you want to extend the dates to stay, you can edit your check-out date via the editing link in your email. If you use the coupon to book a discounted room, your discount will apply to the rooms on valid dates (March 4th to March 12th).

If you are coming with your children

If you want to bring your family, please make a reservation for 1 or 2 adults with the coupon code above first. Once the reservation is confirmed, please email taipei.grand@hyatt.com or make a phone call at +886 2 2720 1234 and ask for support with your reference code.

Stay for children younger than 12 years old will be free of charge. Children older than 12 will be charged 1,900 TWD + 15.5% tax for each person (without breakfast).

I don’t see any rooms when I use the coupon code.

The discounted rooms are limited and in high demand. Rooms might sell out on specific days but be available on other days. You may change the time period to make a reservation with the discounted price first and subsequently make another reservation with the listed price. Grand Hyatt will help you arrange the same room.

Can I book multiple rooms at the same time?

No, due to the system’s settings, you can book at most 2 rooms in each reservation. Given the limited rooms and potential number of interested parties, we strongly recommend that you book the rooms immediately. Contacting Hyatt will require lead time, and rooms may run out during that period.

Volunteer questions 

  • Do we get funded on travel or accommodation expenses?
    • No, we don’t cover expenses for volunteers. 

Payment questions

What are the payment method supported for both general tickets purchase and sponsorship payment.

  • Ticket purchase – both credit card and PayPal are supported.
  • Sponsorship – International sponsors will receive invoicing sent via WordCamp Central with payment via wire transfer. For local (Taiwan) sponsors, payment can be though OCF (Open Culture Foundation) for local VAT receipt.

content.rendered:
Taipei International Convention Center (TICC)

Address: No. 1, Section 5, Xinyi Rd, Xinyi District, Taipei City, 11049.

Get Map Directions
Floor Plans

This prestigious venue is located in Taipei’s commercial and financial hub, just a 3-minute walk from Taipei 101, the iconic landmark of Taiwan. With a main hall capacity of over 3000 people, it provides ample space for our attendees. The closest MRT station is Taipei 101/World Trade Center station.

Located in the bustling Xinyi District, TICC is situated in the heart of Taipei’s liveliest area. The iconic Taipei 101 stands tall as a landmark, surrounded by numerous shopping malls, renowned restaurants, diverse bars, and upscale residences. The nightlife here is a magnet for both tourists and locals alike, offering opportunities to savor a beer outdoors, hit the dance floor, or indulge in finely crafted cocktails at rooftop bars. No matter your preference, you won’t be disappointed.

Transportation

  • MRT (Taipei Metro): Taipei 101/World Trade Center Station Exit 1
  • Public bus
  • Uber, or Taxi

How to get to the venue from the airport?

Taoyuan International Airport

To get to the venue from Taoyuan International Airport (TPE), you have the options of private transfers like taxis and Uber, or public transport like the Airport MRT and shuttle buses. Taxis and Uber are available outside the arrival hall, costing approximately NT$900-1200. They offer convenience and operate 24/7. The Airport MRT, with a charge of NT$160, is the fastest public transport option, reaching Taipei in 35 minutes and operating from early morning to late night. Shuttle buses, costing NT$90 – NT$145, take about 50-70 minutes to reach the Taipei 101 area and run until after midnight.

Taipei Songshan Airport

To reach the Taipei International Convention Center from Taipei Songshan Airport (TSA), you have options for both private and public transport. Taxis and Uber are available 24/7, with a journey time of about 20-30 minutes and a cost of NT$200-400. For public transport, buses are accessible nearby with several stops (refer to a Google Map for details). Alternatively, you can take the MRT: start with the brown line from TSA, transfer to the red line at Daan, and alight at Taipei 101/World Trade Center station, using Exit No.1 to find the convention center. The MRT fare is around NT$25.

Next Stop, Taiwan!

We are thrilled to introduce an incredible opportunity for all attendees to join us on an exciting adventure!
The Taiwan Ministry of Digital Affairs (moda) has paved the way for international digital talents like you through the Gold Card in the Digital Field. This program is your ticket to industry exchanges within Taiwan, including the chance to attend fantastic events like WordCamp Asia 2024.

Get Help
Apply Now

*If you would like to get 1-on-1 help from TCA (Taipei Computer Association, the executing agency), make sure to select WordCamp Asia 2024 in the form.
** When applying for Gold Card, please ensure to select Digital Field to specify your area of expertise.
*** A more detailed application tutorial please see here.

Why Should I Apply for Digital Field Gold Card?

The 4-in-1 Card

1

Work Permit

Allows cardholders to seek employment freely, obtain employment at any time, work any part-time job legally, and freely change jobs.

2

Resident Visa

Long-term visa which allows cardholders to stay in Taiwan for more than 180 days.

3

Alien Resident Certificate

A physical ID card proving that you can live in Taiwan legally.

4

Re-entry Permit

Allows unlimited entry and exit from Taiwan (even during COVID-19).

One-time Travel Incentive to Taiwan

You will receive a US$1,300 to US$2,750 travel incentive to Taiwan based on your region. Reimbursable items include flight tickets, accommodation fees, Internet fees, and event tickets in Taiwan. For more details, please read Application Guideline: Coverage Items and Limits.

Some other benefits include access to National Health Insurance, reduced income taxes in Taiwan for the first 5 years, and the ability to lease and own property in Taiwan.

Can I Apply?

Everyone is welcome to apply if you meet ONE or more of the following requirements:

  • Working Seniority: Over 8 years of professional experience in the digital economy sector.
  • Compensation: Employed in a relevant field with a recent monthly salary of at least NT$160,000.
  • Academic Achievement: Graduated from a university ranked in the Top 500 worldwide and holding a doctoral degree from that institution.
  • Relevant Expertise: Included academic certifications, winning awards, or having more than 4 years of relevant work experience.

More qualification details are here.

To apply for the Gold Card in the Digital Field, you will need to complete the “Foreign Special Professionals with Specialized Knowledge/Skills in the Digital Field” document, regardless of the qualification you choose. In the “□ Other Relevant Important Experiences” section, we recommend including all WordCamp and other tech event organizer/speaker experiences, as well as Make WordPress team representative or contributor experiences.

We also recommend including your profile at WordPress.org, LinkedIn, GitHub, Dribbble, portfolio website, and anything that can showcase your professional experiences in your CV/resume.

The Gold Card costs anywhere between US$100 and US$310 depending on your nationality and the duration of the card.

Get Help
Apply Now

*If you would like to get 1-on-1 help from TCA (Taipei Computer Association, the executing agency), make sure to select WordCamp Asia 2024 in the form.
** When applying for Gold Card, please ensure to select Digital Field to specify your area of expertise.
*** A more detailed application tutorial please see here.

FAQ

What is the Digital Economy?

The “digital economy” mentioned in these Guidelines refers to economic activities driven by digital industries, along with innovation activities of non-digital industries through digital technology (in accordance with the OECD [Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development] and British definitions of “digital economy”). Its fields and categories include but are not limited to the following：

(A) Application of Innovation Technology: Including artificial intelligence such as machine learning, deep learning, image recognition, and semantic analysis; data sciences such as data processing, data analysis, data visualization, and web scraping; smart networking such as Internet of Things (IoT), 5G communications, cloud computing, and communications technology.

(B) Development of the Digital Economy: Including digital marketing, financial technology (FinTech), e-commerce, sharing economy, digital content (such as AR/VR, 3D design, UI/UX design, etc.), research and analysis of digital economy policies, and investment analysis for international markets.

Uploading Document Guidelines

Documents must be in English or Chinese

If your documents are not in English or Chinese, please attach a translation to either English or Chinese. You have the option to translate the documents yourself and attach both the translated and original documents.

Additional Document Verification

Before submitting your Gold Card application, please note that documents issued by the following countries/regions require additional verification by an overseas ROC representative office: Afghanistan, Algeria, Bengal, Bhutan, Myanmar, Cambodia, Cameroon, Cuba, Ghana, Iran, Iraq, Laos, Nepal, Niger, Nigeria, Pakistan, Senegal, Somalia, Sri Lanka, Syria, Philippines, Thailand, Vietnam, Malaysia, and Indonesia. Some exceptions apply; please refer to this link for details.

For verification submission, document delivery must be done in the representative office, while you can receive the document back by mail after processing. If entrusting someone else, please ensure to fill out the Application Form for Authentication. The verification process typically takes about 2 working days.

Letter of Taiwanese Guarantee

Gold Card applicants from designated countries will be asked by the overseas missions of the R.O.C. to provide Letter of Guarantee for Visa Application to the Republic of China. These countries include Afghanistan, Algeria, Bangladesh, Bhutan, Cameroon, Gambia, Ghana, India, Iraq, Nepal, Niger, Nigeria, Pakistan, Senegal, Somalia, Sri Lanka, and Syria. For more details, please refer to here.

If you are a sponsor, speaker, volunteer, table lead, or organizer of WordCamp Asia 2024, you can request the Letter of Guarantee from us. If you are an attendee of WordCamp Asia 2024, we will review based on your contribution to WordPress. Please contact asia-local@wordcamp.org.

How much does the Gold Card cost?

The cost depends on the country of citizenship and the duration of the Gold Card. The application fee is nonrefundable regardless of the results of your application. For more details, please see Step 1 Section 4: Payment and E-Mail Confirmation ↗.

How long does the process take?

A perfect application takes 30 days, however, if additional supporting documents are requested, expect a time frame of 50-60 days. For a detailed timeline on how long it takes, please refer to here.

How do I apply for travel incentive?

You must have a Gold Card application approved before you can apply for the travel incentive. You need to apply at least 15 working days prior to your arrival in Taiwan, and fulfill obligations in Taiwan (such as attending WordCamp Asia 2024). Read more details about Incentive Process.

Do I need to visit the embassy/overseas ROC representative office?

Additional Document Verification (before you submit Gold Card application): Documents issued by some countries/regions require additional verification by an overseas ROC representative office. Please read FAQ → Uploading Document Guidelines → Additional Document Verification.

STEP 2: Passport Check: For overseas applications (except Hong Kong/Macau applications), your passport will have to be inspected at your chosen Bureau of Consular Affairs or ROC mission/office. Under normal circumstances, this process should take a week.

STEP 3: Receiving your Gold Card: After verification, you will receive an email stating your passport has been inspected and the Gold Card application was approved, you will then pick up the Gold Card after you arrive in Taiwan. We recommend to choose Taipei City Service Center when choosing Location of Collection.

Taipei City Service Center
Address: No. 15, Guangzhou St., Zhongzheng District, Taipei City 100-66, Taiwan, ROC.
Chinese Address: 臺北市廣州街15號1樓

Who can I contact about the Gold Card?

Gold Card is organized by Taiwan Ministry of Digital Affairs (moda) and executed by Taipei Computer Assosciation (TCA). If you would like to get 1 on 1 service from TCA, please fill out the form here or see contact information below:

LinkedIn: Team DIGI Gold Card

General Gold Card Questions:
Jill Chang jill_chang@mail.tca.org.tw 
Dana Liu preedanan@mail.tca.org.tw 

Application of Industry Exchange Incentives Questions:
Vicky Ho vicky_ho@mail.tca.org.tw 
Kelly Chuang kelly_chuang@mail.tca.org.tw

content.rendered:
Celebrate WordPress, Experience Asia

Welcome to WordCamp Asia 2024 – the ultimate gathering for around 2,000 WordPress enthusiasts! Join us at the Taipei International Convention Center (TICC) from March 7th to 9th, 2024, for an extraordinary event dedicated to all things WordPress. 

WordCamp Asia 2024 is a celebration of the vibrant WordPress community from Asia and beyond.

Immerse yourself in a diverse array of programs, workshops, and presentations, where industry experts will share their wisdom, and cutting-edge trends will be unveiled. Embrace the spirit of collaboration and giving back during our dedicated Contributor Day, where you can contribute to the WordPress project and make a lasting impact. 

There’s more – we also want to show you the beauty of Taipei. Experience the rich culture, tantalizing cuisine, and awe-inspiring sights that this dynamic city offers. Our after-party will be a chance to make new friends and create lasting memories! 

Join us at WordCamp Asia 2024 for an unforgettable experience. Connect, learn, and be inspired in this captivating city, where technology meets tradition and innovation thrives amidst cultural splendor.

See you there!

Dates

WordCamp Asia 2024 is a 3-day event in March 2024.

March 7

Contributor Day
(Sign up only)

Welcome Party
(Invite Only)

March 8

Conference Day 1

March 9

Conference Day 2 &
After Party

Location

Taipei International Convention Center (TICC) , Taiwan
Address: No. 1, Section 5, Xinyi Rd, Xinyi District, Taipei City, 110

Learn more about the location

What are WordCamps?

WordCamps are volunteer-organized conferences covering everything related to WordPress, the free and Open-Source personal publishing software that powers over 43% of the web.

Since 2006, WordPress community members have held a total of 1,100+ WordCamps in 375+ cities, 65 countries, and 6 continents.

* The Open Culture Foundation (OCF) serves as the local representative entity for WordCamp Asia 2024 in Taiwan. They provide assistance with the eVisa process and support our event’s finance operations in the region.

Our Vision

At the kick-off of WordCamp Asia 2020, we shared our vision for this event. These remain the 2024 team’s guiding principles.

Welcoming

Make it an inclusive, affordable, and interactive event.

Nurturing

Celebrate and support the growth of sustainable communities.

Experimental

Don’t be afraid to try new things, and learn from doing.

What is the Contributor Day?

You do not need to be a programmer or designer to know anything concerning WordPress to participate in Contributor Day. A great way to learn about the project and give to it is to participate by contribution.

Learn more about Contributor Day

title.rendered: WordCamp Asia 2025: Searching for the Perfect Host City

content.rendered:
From the vibrant streets of Bangkok in 2023, and WordCampAsia 2024 being scheduled in Taipei March 7th to 9th 2024, the torch is ready to be passed on. Want your city to be the beacon for the WordPress community in 2025? WordCamp Asia is on the lookout for its next destination, and it might just be your hometown.

Steering the colossal ship that is WordCamp Asia isn’t a one-team job. It’s a harmonious dance between two main groups: the local and global teams. The local contingent will emerge from the host city’s passionate WordPress enthusiasts, while the global brigade comprises seasoned WordCamp organizers from all over the continent. As the event unfolds, we’ll be seeking for even more talented organizers to join the fray.

The beauty of WordCamp Asia lies in the fusion of local charm and global expertise. With this potent mix, we’re eager to find the perfect city to be our hub for 2025!

Who’s Eligible to Host the Grandeur of WordCamp Asia 2025?

To bring WordCamp Asia’s flagship event to your city, please ensure that:

  • Your community has remained active throughout 2023.
  • Your city has successfully hosted at least one WordCamp in the last four years.
  • There’s a dedicated local team with eight or more proactive organizers.

Deciphering the Selection Process

A panel of global leaders, seasoned in the intricacies of WordCamp, will meticulously review each application. If there’s a need for further understanding or clarifications, the team will reach out to the applicants.

Upon concluding the evaluation, the top contenders will be the first to receive the results.

Unveiling the Next Destination

The grand reveal of our 2025 host city will occur during the closing ceremony of WordCamp Asia 2024 in Taipei.

Ready to Step into the Limelight?

Are you excited to see your city shine as the next WordCamp Asia destination?

Submission dateline will be by 31st Jan. 2024.

Apply Now

content.rendered:
WordCamp Asia 2024 is the biggest WordPress event in Asia, and we are looking for emcees to help us make it a success!

As an emcee, you will be responsible for introducing speakers, leading Q&A after each session, and keeping the audience engaged throughout the event. One should have a strong stage presence, be able to speak clearly and confidently, and be able to ad-lib when necessary.

If you are a member of the WordPress community and are passionate about helping others learn and grow, we encourage you to apply to be an emcee at WordCamp Asia 2024.

Responsibilities

  • Introduce speakers and lead Q&A sessions
  • Keep the audience engaged throughout the event
  • Ad-lib when necessary
  • Passion for the WordPress community and helping others learn and grow

To apply, please fill out the following form by October 31, 2023

Apply Now

We look forward to receiving your application!

Frequently Asked Questions

  • What are the benefits of being an emcee at WordCamp Asia 2024?

As an emcee, you will have the opportunity to network with hundreds of members of the WordPress community, learn from leading experts in the field, and make a real difference in the success of the event. You will also receive a complimentary ticket to attend WordCamp Asia 2024.

  • Do I need to have experience as an emcee to apply?

Experience is not required, but it is a plus. We are looking for individuals with a strong stage presence and the ability to connect with an audience.

  • Should you buy a ticket?

You can purchase a ticket when each ticket batch sales have opened. If you are selected as an emcee, we will be giving you a complimentary ticket to attend the event. Then you can transfer your purchased ticket to someone else.

  • What will the selection process be like?

We will review all applications and select a team of emcees based on their qualifications and experience. We will also consider the diversity of the applicant pool when making our selections.

  • When will I be notified if I have been selected?

We will notify selected emcees by November 2023.
If you have any other questions, please do not hesitate to contact us at asia.wordcamp.org .
We look forward to seeing your application!

content.rendered:
Join the A/V Team for WordCamp Asia 2024!

Are you ready to be a part of WordCamp Asia 2024 and showcase your photography, videography, interview, and editing talents?

We are thrilled to announce a call for all A/V enthusiasts, regardless of your skill level (Photographers, Videographers, and Interviewers). If you have a passion for capturing moments through your lenses and bringing an artistic touch to events, we want you on board!

Come Capture the Magic of #WCAsia with Us

WordCamp Asia is set to take place in the vibrant city of Taipei, Taiwan, and we’re inviting you to lend your expertise in photography, filming, editing, and communication to this incredible event. Whether you prefer candid or posed shots, formal or informal settings, interviews or podcasts, your unique perspective is invaluable in preserving the essence of the event. Whether you’re a seasoned pro or an enthusiastic beginner, this is a fantastic opportunity to enhance your skills and gain exposure.

We’re also planning to share the excitement of the event through our social media channels, so we’ve added the role of Photo and Video Editor alongside photography, videography, and interviewing.

Feeling Inspired? Let’s Dive into the Details.

Key Information about the Roles

Join the A/V Team Crew at WCAsia 2024 in one of the following roles:

  • Photographer
  • Photo Editor
  • Videographer
  • Video Editor
  • Interviewer

We understand that your passion drives your artistry, and the act of creation is truly empowering and captivating. Being a part of the A/V Team crew at WordCamp Asia 2024 offers you invaluable experience and the chance to connect with fascinating individuals from all over the world while collaborating with fellow crew members.

As a Photographer/Videographer, you’re encouraged to:

  • Express Your Unique Style: Embrace your creative individuality to craft captivating visuals that stand out.
  • Craft High-Quality Content: Elevate your photography and videography skills to produce exceptional, top-tier content.
  • Refine and Polish: Bring your work to its full potential through expert editing and enhancements.
  • Share with the World: Your creations will have a global reach, as they’ll be shared under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International license, allowing a wide audience to appreciate your artistry.

As an Interviewer, you’re free to interview:

  • Organizers
  • Speakers
  • Sponsors
  • Attendees


Please note that A/V Team crew positions, like all other roles at WordCamp Asia, are voluntary, and no monetary compensation is provided. We kindly ask all team members to utilize their own cameras and equipment to fulfill their roles.

Hey there, aspiring event photographer! To capture stunning moments at WordCamp Asia 2024 like a pro, you’ll want to have the right gear in your camera bag. Here’s a handy checklist of essential equipment

  • Camera(s):
    • A high-end DSLR or mirrorless camera is essential for professional photography. Look for models with good low-light performance and high-resolution sensors.
    • Consider having at least one backup camera in case of technical issues.
  • Lenses:
    • A selection of lenses is crucial to cover various photography scenarios. At a minimum, you should have:
      • A standard zoom lens (e.g., 24-70mm or 24-105mm) for general use.
      • A fast prime lens with a wide aperture (e.g., f/1.4 or f/1.8) for low-light conditions and portraits.
      • A telephoto lens (e.g., 70-200mm) for capturing subjects at a distance.
  • Tripod:
    • A sturdy tripod is essential for stability when shooting in low light or for long exposure shots.
  • External Flash(es):
    • External flashes are valuable for controlling and enhancing lighting conditions, especially in indoor environments.
  • Memory Cards and Storage:
    • Ensure you have high-capacity and high-speed memory cards to handle RAW image files.
    • Bring extra storage solutions like external hard drives or a laptop for backing up photos during the event.
  • Batteries and Chargers:
    • Carry spare camera batteries and chargers to keep your camera powered throughout the event.
  • Lens Cleaning Kit:
    • Dust and smudges can affect image quality. A lens cleaning kit will help you keep your lenses clean.
  • Camera Bag:
    • Invest in a quality camera bag to transport and protect your equipment.
  • Lighting Equipment (Optional):
    • Depending on the event’s lighting conditions, you may need additional lighting equipment, such as off-camera flashes or continuous lights.

As a token of our appreciation for your dedication, you’ll receive a complimentary ticket to WordCamp Asia 2024 and an exclusive invitation to join us at our before and after WordCamp parties. Your commitment and talent are invaluable in creating an extraordinary event experience!

Ready to Apply?

We extend a warm welcome to both seasoned WordCamp volunteers and those considering this as their first experience.

No matter where you are on your journey, if you’re passionate about photography, freestyle filming, event coverage, and interviews, we invite you to apply now and become a part of our A/V Team crew!

WordCamp is an event like no other, and your support will help make it unforgettable. Bring your unique perspective, along with your photography, videography, and interviewing skills, to Taipei in March 2024.

Don’t forget to include a link to your online portfolio or gallery in your application. We can only evaluate your application if you provide examples of your work.

The application deadline is October 31, 2023, so don’t miss out on the opportunity to capture all the magic happening between March 7-9, 2024, in Taipei, Taiwan.

Thank you for your patience and enthusiasm!

Apply now

content.rendered:
WordPress places a strong emphasis on collaboration and community. For many individuals, WordCamps serve as their initial foray into the world of contributing. Gathering for these collaborative events worldwide presents a wonderful opportunity to collectively share and learn. Sharing your personal stories of contribution at WordCamps can play a crucial role in inspiring new contributors to join this fantastic journey.

We aim to inspire an even greater number of individuals to participate in the event, acquire new skills, and leverage their talents to enhance WordPress. Without contributors, there would be no Contributor Day and no WordPress at all!

Our intention is to showcase stories from experienced contributors who have found fulfillment in their contributions at these events. The WordCamp Asia 2024 Contributor Day Team will carefully curate a selection that encompasses various levels of engagement. This compilation will highlight voices from contributors around the world, all sharing their experiences within the WordPress community. These published contributor stories will be featured on our WordCamp Asia 2024 Blog. 

We’d love to hear any captivating stories you’d like to share!

FAQ

Here are some details to guide you through the process of submitting your stories. If you have any additional questions or need further information, please don’t hesitate to reach out to us via email. (asia[@]wordcamp.org)

Can I submit my stories in all the formats? (Text, Audio, and Video)

Certainly, we welcome submissions in any form or format that you feel most comfortable with. Your creativity and individuality are encouraged, so feel free to submit your stories in the way that best suits you. 

What are the audio or video file limits?

Your audio or video file should not be more than 10 minutes.

Which language should I use?

We highly encourage you to submit stories in English so organizers reviewing submissions can evaluate them equally. But, if you are not able to share your stories in English, you can submit it in your own language and we’ll try to translate it into English. 

What is our submission deadline and process?

The Call for Contributor’s Stories will be open until November 22, 2023, so please make sure that you send in your submission in time.

Do I need to share my photo?

Yes, it would help us and everyone visiting our blog to know your stories and your contribution to WordPress Communities.

What if I need to edit my stories?

We are using Google Forms to accept your stories. You will receive a copy of your submission with the edit link to it via email. Please ensure that the email you use is a valid email address.

Will my stories be published directly or edited before being published?

We’ll try our best to publish the story without editing. But if there are some typos or grammatical errors, we’ll fix them before publishing. 

I have a video on my YouTube channel about my contribution stories. Can I submit that?

We request you to create a dedicated video specially for WordCamp Asia 2024. So, we don’t accept the pre-made content.  

Share your stories

To participate, kindly share your contribution story in 250 words or fewer, accompanied by text, audio, or visual records (1-10 minutes) via your preferred social media platforms, which you’d like us to accompany with.

Please submit your stories by November 25, 2023, for an opportunity to be showcased on the WordCamp Asia 2024 blog and our social media channels.

Share your story

content.rendered:
The WordCamp Asia Team is calling on everyone to submit their Wapuu design for WordCamp Asia 2024!

What is Wapuu?

As a result of an idea first brought up during the WordCamp Tokyo 2009 after-party, Wapuu was created by Kaneuchi Kazuko as an unofficial mascot for WordPress in Japan. The first Wapuu was unveiled at WordCamp Fukuoka 2011.

The Original Wapuu was created by Kaneuchi Kazuko 

Since then, the WordPress communities all over the world have been creating their own versions of Wapuu usually holding something that represents the local culture. People can’t get enough of Wapuu that the little guy shows up everywhere, especially at WordCamps!

Some of the Wapuu designs from https://wapu.us

What Do We need?

A Wapuu that best represents WordCamp Asia 2024? One that embodies:

  • Asian culture or the local culture of the host city – Taipei!
  • The vision for WordCamp Asia 2024:
    WordCamp is a platform for expressing inclusivity, diversity, engagement, sharing, and support. We extend a warm invitation to individuals from various countries and backgrounds. In particular, for WordCamp 2024, we are enthusiastic about embracing a wider representation of speakers, and attendees from diverse fields beyond the WordPress community. It’s a sanctuary where you can feel secure, embraced, and encouraged to contribute your unique perspective and talents.

Important Notes

  • Submission is free of charge. 
  • Everyone can submit a design; this call is not limited to designers or illustrators only.
  • You can submit as an individual or as a team.
  • You can submit more than one design.
  • Please do not submit an already published design.
  • Please submit your original design and adhere to copyright laws. If the submission is plagiarized or violates any copyrights/trademark laws, it will be excluded from consideration.
  • The winning Wapuu will be widely used everywhere at WordCamp Asia 2024 such as on original swags, banners, posters, etc. 
  • All submissions will be evaluated by WordCamp Asia organisers.
  • The copyright for the chosen Wapuu shall belong to the original designer a.k.a YOU!
  • The WordCamp Asia design team might change or alter your original design to suit the needs of the event.
  • Please ensure that your design follows Wapuu guidelines.

Important Dates

  • Application Deadline: November 10, 2023, 23:59 UTC +7
  • Winner Announcement: November 20, 2023

The Winner Receives

  • All swags that the winning Wapuu appears on in WordCamp Asia 2024
  • A mention on WordCamp Asia 2024 Wapuu announcement post

Questions?

If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact us through email asia@wordcamp.org, or through this form.

How to Submit?

It’s easy to submit!

  1. Download the original Wapuu file here: https://github.com/jawordpressorg/wapuu. Please use this file when designing your Wapuu. Please ensure that your design follows Wapuu guidelines.
  2. Upload your Wapuu design created in vector format (.svg) to Google Drive, GitHub, or Figma.
  3. Share the URL with us through the form below.
Call for Wapuu has closed

We look forward to your submissions! (/^▽^)/
